block.p: Nathalie Flora Gimon, the daughter of Eleanor Hewlett Gimon and Jean-Paul Georges Gimon of Greenwich, Conn., was married at the New York City Municipal Building on Thursday to Dr. Amir Ali Farman-Farma, the son of Haroon Al Rashid Farman-Farmaian of London and Manijeh Mir Damad of Southampton, N.Y. Yesterday, Dr. Iraj Anvar led an Islamic and Persian ceremony in Greenwich, Conn.

Mrs. Farman-Farma, 32, was an associate editor at The New Yorker magazine until this year. She is a magna cum laude graduate of Brown University and received a master's degree in classics from Columbia and another graduate degree from the Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales in Paris. Her father retired as head of the United States office of Credit Lyonnais, the French bank, in New York.

Yesterday, Dr. Iraj Anvar led an Islamic and Persian ceremony in Greenwich, Conn.

Mrs. Farman-Farma, 32, was an associate editor at The New Yorker magazine until this year. She is a magna cum laude graduate of Brown University and received a master's degree in classics from Columbia and another graduate degree from the Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales in Paris. Her father retired as head of the United States office of Credit Lyonnais, the French bank, in New York.

Mr. Farman-Farma, 36, works for Fortune Asset Management in London as a consultant on hedge funds. The bridegroom, who shortened his name, graduated cum laude from Harvard and received a doctorate in politics from Oxford. His father, who is retired, is a former owner of F.&H. R. Farman-Farmaian, which was a consulting engineering firm in Tehran, Iran.
